input:
What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Diabetic ketoacidosis without coma

You are a patient: You are a 19-year-old male.
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- Increased thirst and dry mouth
- Frequent urination and feeling very hungry
- Fatigue and some weakness
- Decreased urine output recently
These symptoms came on suddenly over the past two days, and you’ve noticed that you feel more dehydrated than usual, with a persistent dry mouth and a strong urge to drink water constantly. You also feel unusually tired and have been waking up multiple times during the night to urinate. You have a history of type 1 diabetes but admit you have been inconsistent with your insulin injections lately due to financial difficulties and some recreational drug use.
output:

ANSWER: Well, I’m 19, and I’m a guy. Um, I’ve been drinking a lot of water and feeling super thirsty all the time, and I guess I’ve been peeing a lot too, but lately it’s been less and I don’t really know why. I’ve been really tired and weak, and I wake up several times at night to go to the bathroom. I think it’s because my blood sugar might be out of control—I have diabetes, but I haven’t been taking my insulin properly because I can’t really afford it right now, and I’ve also been using some drugs recreationally. It’s just not feeling right, and I thought I should come in and see what’s going on.
